valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a morphologically defined name word meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
valsi.notes: In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. In Lojban, a {cmevla} may only consist of a single word, whereas a {cmene} can consist of one or multiple words, which may be cmevla. See also {vlaturge'a}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (du'u) is a predicate relationship with relation $x_{2}$ among arguments (sequence/set) $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_3$ are related by relation $x_2$ (= {terbri} for reordered places). ($x_3$ is a set completely specified); See also {sumti}, {fancu}.

valsi.definition: $x_2=b_1$ (du'u) is a predicate relationship with relation $x_1=b_2$ among arguments $x_3=b_3$ (ordered set).
$x_{1}$ is a/the argument of predicate/function $x_{2}$ filling place $x_{3}$ (kind/number).
$x_{1}$ is a (Lojban) root word expressing relation $x_{2}$ among argument roles $x_{3}$, with affix(es) $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Gismu list, if physical object (= ({loi}) {gimste}); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new gismu to the gismu list = {gimpoi}, {gimselcmi}, {gimselste}). See also {cmavo}, {cmene}, {lujvo}, {smuni}, {sumti}, {tanru}, {valsi}.

valsi.definition: pro-sumti: this here; immediate demonstrative it; indicated thing/place near speaker.
pro-sumti: that there; nearby demonstrative it; indicated thing/place near listener.
pro-sumti: that yonder; distant demonstrative it; indicated thing far from speaker&listener.
name descriptor: the one(s) called ... ; takes name or selbri description.
$x_{1}$ [seller] sells/vends $x_{2}$ [goods/service/commodity] to buyer $x_{3}$ for amount/cost/expense $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is a salesperson/salesman/vendor; $x_3$ buys $x_2$ from $x_1$ (= {terve'u} for reordered terms); $x_4$ is the price of $x_2$ to $x_3$ (= {velve'u} for reordered terms); for sale (= {fitselve'u}, {selvenfriti}); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyve'u}, {posyselve'u} for unambiguous semantics). (cf. {canja}, {dunda}, {janta}, {pleji}, {jerna}, {kargu}, {prali}, {zarci}, {vamji}, {jdima}; see note at {jdima} on cost/price/value distinction, {fepni}, {friti}, {jerna}, {rupnu})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ talks/speaks to $x_{2}$ about subject $x_{3}$ in language $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Not limited to vocal speech, but this is implied by the $x_4$ without context of some other medium of conversation (use {cusku}, {casnu}, {skicu}, {ciksi} for weaker implication of vocal communication); converse/discuss/chat (= {simta'a}, {simsku}, {vricysimta'a} for a conversation not clearly delimited by subject). See also {bacru}, {cusku} for actual expression, {casnu}, {darlu}, {skicu}, {ciksi}, {bangu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is fast/swift/quick/hastes/rapid at doing/being/bringing about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$c_1$ is blue-green.
$x_{1}$ is beautiful/pleasant to $x_{2}$ in aspect $x_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful. See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ runs on surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$ with gait $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ comes/goes to destination $x_{2}$ from origin $x_{3}$ via route $x_{4}$ using means/vehicle $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: Also travels, journeys, moves, leaves to ... from ...; $x_1$ is a traveller; ($x_4$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly). See also {cadzu}, {bajra}, {marce}, {vofli}, {litru}, {muvdu}, {cpare}, cmavo list {ka'a}, {pluta}, {bevri}, {farlu}, {limna}, {vitke}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (event/state) seems pleasant to/pleases $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a dog/canine/[bitch] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for $x_{2}$ (object/event/person).
valsi.notes: Also tends, cares for, keeps; $x_1$ is a keeper/custodian of $x_2$. See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ remains/stays at/abides/lasts with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a market/store/exchange/shop(s) selling/trading (for) $x_{2}$, operated by/with participants $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: mall, marketplace, shopping center, cooperative, bazaar, trading post, mart; the concept is the function of selling/exchanging coupled with a location, and is more oriented to the larger concept of marketplace than the stalls/shops that comprise it, though it does not exclude the latter individual shops (= {zaisle}); $x_3$ may include both owners/proprietors and customers in some markets, but in most contexts refers only to the operators. See also {vecnu}, {canja}, {dinju}, {banxa}.

valsi.definition: elidable marker: separates selbri from preceding sumti, allows preceding terminator elision.
pro-sumti: an elliptical/unspecified value; has some value which makes bridi true.
$x_{1}$ is a structure word of grammatical class $x_{2}$, with meaning/function $x_{3}$ in usage (language) $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_4$ may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; $x_3$ and $x_4$ may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) {ma'oste}); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = {ma'orpoi}, {ma'orselcmi}, {ma'orselste}). See also {gismu}, {lujvo}, {gerna}, {smuni}, {valsi}.

valsi.definition: 2nd conversion; switch 1st/2nd places.
3rd conversion; switch 1st/3rd places.
4th conversion; switch 1st/4th places.
5th conversion; switch 1st/5th places.
discursive: paragraph break; introduce new topic.
sentence link/continuation; continuing sentences on same topic; normally elided for new speakers.
discursive: true-false question.
$x_{1}$ is a binary metaphor formed with $x_{2}$ modifying $x_{3}$, giving meaning $x_{4}$ in usage/instance $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ and $x_3$ are both text or both si'o concept) See also {gismu}, {smuni}.

valsi.definition: pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.
non-veridical descriptor: the one(s) described as ...
$v_1$ is a morphologically defined predicate word signifying relation $b_2$ in language $v_3$.
valsi.notes: Derived from {bridi} and {valsi}, deleting $b_3$, as we are speaking of the relationship independent of particular arguments. In Lojban, such words must end in a vowel and contain a consonant cluster within the first five letters (not counting y). Not all words that can be used as a selbri (for instance members of GOhA) are brivla.

valsi.definition: pro-bridi: preceding bridi; in answer to a yes/no question, repeats the claim, meaning yes.
pro-sumti: the last utterance.
pro-sumti: the referent of the last utterance; the state described: "IT was fun".
generic vocative marker; identifies intended listener; elidable after COI.
pro-sumti: you listener(s); identified by vocative.
vocative: greetings/hello.
vocative: partings/good-bye.
pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.
pro-sumti: sumti question (what/who/how/why/etc.); appropriately fill in sumti blank.
pro-bridi: bridi/selbri/brivla question.
bridi contradictory negator; scope is an entire bridi; logically negates in some cmavo compounds.
evidential: I observe.
evidential: I opine (subjective claim).
evidential: I postulate.
time tense relation/direction: did [selbri]; before/prior to [sumti]; default past tense.
time tense relation/direction: is [selbri]; during/simultaneous with [sumti]; present tense.
location tense distance: far from ... ; yonder at ... ; a long distance from ...
location tense distance: here at ... ; at or a very short/tiny distance from ...
time tense relation/direction: will [selbri]; after [sumti]; default future tense.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a compound predicate word with meaning $x_{2}$ and arguments $x_{3}$ built from metaphor $x_{4}$.
$x_1=v_1=f_1$ is a loanword meaning $x_2=v_2$ in language $x_3=v_3$, based on word $x_4=f_2$ in language $x_5$.
valsi.notes: Historically also used to describe words in the Lojban morphological class allocated for use by {vonfu'ivla}; that sense is now deprecated in favor of {zi'evla}. See also {pavyfu'ivla}, {relfu'ivla}, {cibyfu'ivla}, {vonfu'ivla}, {zi'evla}, {le'avla}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is an affix/suffix/prefix/combining-form for word/concept $x_{2}$, form/properties $x_{3}$, language $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is the class of structure word $x_{2}$, which means or has function $x_{3}$ in language $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ can, for some speakers, take not just cmavo but any word.

valsi.definition: letteral for '.
letteral for k.
attitudinal: suggestion - abandon suggest - warning.
digit/number: 0 (digit) [zero].
$x_{1}$ is a sofa/couch (noun).
hesitation noise; maintains the floor while speaker decides what to say next.
attitudinal: wonder - commonplace.
letteral for c.
letteral for i.
digit/number: 2 (digit) [two].
logical connective: sumti afterthought or.
logical connective: sumti afterthought and.
sentence link/continuation; continuing sentences on same topic; normally elided for new speakers.
logical connective: sumti afterthought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if.
logical connective: sumti afterthought whether-or-not.
non-logical connective: set link, unordered; "and also", but forming a set.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 3 (usually restricted).
sumti place tag: tag 4th sumti place.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal whether-or-not (with gi).
attitudinal: desire - indifference - reluctance.
attitudinal: obligation - freedom.
attitudinal: belief - skepticism - disbelief.
attitudinal: relaxation - composure - stress.
attitudinal question: confusion about something said.
attitudinal: attitudinal question; how do you feel about it? with what intensity?.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s).
cusku modal, 1st place (attribution/quotation) as said by source ...; used for quotation.
attitudinal: agreement - disagreement.
attitudinal: fear - security.
attitudinal: respect - disrespect.
attitudinal: love - no love lost - hatred.
attitudinal: discovery - confusion/searching.
attitudinal: surprise - not really surprised - expectation.
attitudinal: happiness - unhappiness.
attitudinal: completion - incompleteness.
attitudinal: pity - cruelty.
Lojban.
letteral for s.
1st assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
2nd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
3rd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
4th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
5th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
$x_{1}$ exceeds/is more than $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni) by amount/excess $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also positive (= {nonmau}). See also cmavo list {mau}, {mleca}, {zenba}, {jmina}, {bancu}, {dukse}, {traji}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of chalk from source $x_{2}$ in form $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ slides/slips/glides on $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ is slick/slippery to/for $x_1$ (= {selsakli} for reordered places). See also {mosra}, {fulta}, {skiji}, {xutla}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains glass of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ celebrates/recognizes/honors $x_{2}$ (event/abstract) with activity/[party] $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_3$ (and {nunsla}) festival/fiesta/celebration/occasion/fair/Holiday (some senses). Not limited to the ameliorative interpretation of 'celebrate': funeral (= {mrobixsla}). See also {sinma}, {jbena}.

valsi.definition: $p_1=t_1$ complains verbally to $p_3=t_2$ about $p_2=t_3$ in language $t_4$
$j_1=z_1$ is/are the left foot/feet of $j_2=z_2$.
joins preceding and following words into a lujvo.
valsi.notes: To make tanru out of arbitrary cmavo, use {ze'oi} instead.

valsi.definition: letteral for b.
$x_{1}$ is ill/sick/diseased with symptoms $x_{2}$ from disease $x_{3}$.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
$x_{1}$ is food/feed/nutriment for $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is edible/gives nutrition to $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of spaghetti (long, thin cylindrical pasta)
valsi.notes: Synonyms: {djarspageti}, {spageti}. This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a tree of species/cultivar $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains cheese/curd from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a snake/serpent of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass of facts) is science of/about subject matter $x_{2}$ based on methodology $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Not limited to science as derived by the scientific method, but pertaining to any body of usually-coherent knowledge garnered/gathered/assembled by a consistent methodology. See also {datni}, {fatci}, {djuno}, {cipra}, {pensi}, {jimpe}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_{2}$ representing $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ glyph, rune, character (also me'o BY/word-bu), $x_2$ symbol set; (adjective:) $x_1$ is alphabetic/symbolic; "letteral" used by analogy with "numeral"; sinxa is the more generic symbol. See also {mifra}, {namcu}, {sinxa}, {pandi}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ - is spaghetti made out of/containing $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a quark with flavor $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a mathematics of type/describing $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a building/edifice for purpose $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [ideal] is the conceptual shape/form of object/abstraction/manifestation $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
valsi.notes: Also pattern; $x_1$ is the mathematical or theoretical ideal form, while $x_2$ is an object/event manifesting that form; e.g. circular/circle-shaped (= {cukseltai}) vs. circle (={cuktai}, while {cukla} alone is ambiguous); model (= {ci'ersaptai}, {saptai}, {ci'ersmitai}, {smitai}). See alse {nejni}, te {marji} for physical shape, {tapla}, {bliku}, {kubli}, {kurfa}, {cukla}, {mapti}, {morna}, {sarlu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of $x_{2}$ to/used-by namer/name-user $x_{3}$ (person).
valsi.notes: Also: $x_2$ is called $x_1$ by $x_3$ (= selcme for reordered places). See also cmavo list {me'e}, {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}. Historically used to describe words in the Lojban morphological class allocated for use with proper nouns; this sense has been deprecated in favor of {cmevla}.

valsi.definition: abstractor: property/quality abstractor (-ness); $x_{1}$ is quality/property exhibited by [bridi].
name descriptor: the mass of individual(s) named ... ; takes name or selbri description.
letteral for l.
non-veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) described as ...
attitudinal modifier: marks empathetic use of preceding attitudinal; shows another's feelings.
pro-sumti: elliptical/unspecified utterance variable.
digit/number: 1 (digit) [one].
$x_{1}$ is the sun of home planet $x_{2}$ (default Earth) of race $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is solar.
valsi.notes: 'home planet' refers to a planet which is "home" to a race, but not necessarily the original "home" of a species if that species inhabits many worlds. See also {gusni}, {lunra}, {mluni}, {plini}, {santa}, {terdi}, {tarci}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is principal/chief/leader/main/[staple], most significant among $x_{2}$ (set) in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
valsi.notes: Staple (= {ralselpra}); general/admiral/president/principal leader (= {ralja'a}, {ralterbe'e}; use additional terms to distinguish among these); also primary, prime, (adverb:) chiefly, principally, mainly; ($x_2$ is complete specification of set). See also {vajni}, te {bende}, {minde}, {lidne}, {jatna}, {jitro}, {gidva}, {midju}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is noble/aristocratic/elite/high-born/titled in/under culture/society/standard $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also upper-class; high/low, upper/lower are poor Lojban metaphors; note $x_2$ standard applies when the title/nobility is not recognized culture/society wide; this would include self-assumed titles. See also {banli}.

valsi.definition: name descriptor: the set of those named ... ; takes name or selbri description.
forethought nonce-word indicator; indicates next word is nonce-creation and may be nonstandard.
$x_{1}$ is a nest/house/lair/den/[home] of/for $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Home (= {tercnizda}), house (constructed building) (= {zdadi'u}). See also {dinju}, {ginka}, {kumfa}, se {xabju}.

valsi.definition: logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal and (with gi).
$z_1$ is a doghouse for dog $z_2=g_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a boat/ship/vessel [vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass/si'o) is a class/category/subgroup/subset within $x_{2}$ with defining property $x_{3}$ (ka).
valsi.notes: Also taxon, type, kind, classification, species, genus, family, order, phylum. See also cmavo list {le'a}, {cmima}, {jutsi}, {ciste}, {girzu}, {lanzu}, {vrici}.

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is a ship type/class within ships $b_1=k_2$, with features $k_3$.
$x_1$ is the Logical Language Group (LLG).
$x_{1}$ is group/cluster/team showing common property (ka) $x_{2}$ due to set $x_{3}$ linked by relations $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also collection, team, comprised of, comprising; members $x_3$ (a specification of the complete membership) comprise group $x_1$; cluster (= {kangri}). See also {bende}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {gunma}, {panra}, {cabra}, {cecmu}, {kansa}, {klesi}, {lanzu}, {liste}, {vrici}.

valsi.definition: start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
$x_1$ is a male teacher of sexuality to audience $x_2$.
Logical Language Group (LLG)
$x_{1}$ is an enemy/opponent/adversary/foe of $x_{2}$ in struggle $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is ready/prepared for $x_{2}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ reflects [Loglandic]/Lojbanic language/culture/nationality/community in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Pre-Lojban forms of Loglan (= {dzejbo}). See also {bangu}, {logji}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is the trigonometric sine of angle/arcsine $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is the trigonometric tangent of angle/arctangent $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects British/United Kingdom culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Gaelic/Scottish culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Irish (= {sicko'o}), Scottish (= {sunko'o}), Celtic (= {dzeko'o}), Welsh (= {nanko'o}), Breton (= {fasko'o}); since Scottish/Gaelic is only the northern branch of the Celtic tribes, many would prefer a fu'ivla for Celtic; nationalism might also demand a separate fu'ivla for Irish. See also {brito}, {glico}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Australian culture/nationality/geography/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Canadian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Argentinian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Russian empire/USSR/ex-USSR (Soviet]/CIS culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Ukrainian language/culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Palestinian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Algerian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Jordanian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Libyan culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Lebanese culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Egyptian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Moroccan culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Iraqi culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Saudi Arabian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Syrian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Indonesian culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Brazilian culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Pakistani/Pashto culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tenth [1/10; $10^{-1}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
valsi.notes: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a hundredth [1/100; $10^{-2}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; $10^{-3}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a millionth [$10^{-6}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a billionth/thousand-millionth [$10^{-9}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a trillionth [$10^{-12}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $10^{-15}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $10^{-18}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $10^{-21}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $10^{-24}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is ten [10; $10^1$ ] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a hundred [100; $10^2$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a thousand [1000; $10^3$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a million [$10^6$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a billion [British milliard] [$10^9$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a trillion [$10^{12}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $10^{15}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $10^{18}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $10^{21}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $10^{24}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ candela [metric unit] in luminosity (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ mole(s) [metric unit] in substance (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ radian(s) [metric unit] in angular measure (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Measured in degrees ({julra'o}); right ascension astronomical measurement. (= {cacryra'o}). See also {jganu}, {kilto}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {gutci}, {litce}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {minli}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ steradian(s) [metric unit] in solid angle (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ ampere(s) [metric unit] in current (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Chinese [Mandarin, Cantonese, Wu, etc.] culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is English/pertains to English-speaking culture in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Generally assume broadest sense of 'English'; may refer to 'English', pertaining to the country/people/culture of England (normally requiring constraint = gligu'e, or simply redundancy = gligli-); British English, the norm language of the UK (= {gliglibau}). (cf. {brito} which refers to the United Kingdom as a whole or to the British empire, {merko}, {sralo}, {kadno}, {skoto})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Hindi language/culture/religion in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Defaults to not include Urdu; Indian (Bharat) nationality may be implied (when constrained by {xingu'e}). See also {srito}, {xurdo}, {bengo}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Spanish-speaking culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Metaphorical restriction to Spain by contrast with xispo (comparable to the distinction between glico and merko/sralo/brito/kadno); Spain (= {sangu'e}); Spanish dialects spoken in Spain, especially Castillian (= {sansanbau}). See also {xispo}, {ketco}, {mexno}, {gento}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Russian culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Arabic-speaking culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Bengali/Bangladesh culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Portuguese culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Malay-Indonesian common language/culture in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Japanese culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects German/Germanic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects French/Gallic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Urdu language/culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects North American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Antarctican culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Polynesian/Oceanian (geographic region) culture/nationality/languages in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects European culture/nationality/geography/Indo-European languages in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Asiatic culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Latin/Roman/Romance culture/empire/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Sanskrit language/Sanskritic/Vedic culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Hebrew/Jewish/Israeli culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Greek/Hellenic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the Buddhist culture/religion/ethos in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the Taoist culture/ethos/religion in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the Islamic/Moslem/Koranic [Quranic] culture/religion/nation in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the Christian religion/culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the common Judeo-Christian-Moslem (Abrahamic) culture/religion/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Semitic [metaphor: Middle-Eastern] language/culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Semitic includes Arabic, Hebrew, Aramaic, and Ethiopian, among others. See also {xrabo}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Slavic language/culture/ethos in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Hispano-American culture/nationalities in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Refers to Spanish-speaking Latin-American countries, not Brazil/Guyana. See also {merko}, {mexno}, {spano}, {ketco}, {bemro}, {gento}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a lemon of variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is yellow/golden [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of citrus [fruit/tree, etc.] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is the modifying part of binary metaphor $x_2$ with modified part/modificand $x_3$ giving meaning $x_4$ in usage/instance $x_5$
valsi.notes: In both English and Lojban, the word {seltau} is the usual way to refer to the left word in a tanru, whereas {tertau} refers to the right word in the tanru.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the modified part/modificand of binary metaphor $x_2$ with modifying part $x_3$, giving meaning $x_4$ in usage/instance $x_5$
valsi.notes: In both English and Lojban, the word {seltau} is the usual way to refer to the left word in a tanru, whereas {tertau} refers to the right word in the tanru.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is big/large in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a person/people (noun) [not necessarily human]; $x_{1}$ displays personality/a persona.
$x_{1}$ is small in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
short scope joiner; joins various constructs with shortest scope and right grouping.
$x_{1}$ is a girl [young female person] of age $x_{2}$ immature by standard $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use verba). See also {nanla}, {verba}, {ninmu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is school/institute/academy at $x_{2}$ teaching subject(s) $x_{3}$ to audien./commun. $x_{4}$ operated by $x_{5}$.
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought and.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought or.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought conditional/only if.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought whether-or-not.
non-logical connective: mixed conjunction; "and" meaning "mixed together", forming a mass.
$x_{1}$ is red/crimson/ruddy [color adjective].
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought and (with gi).
logical connective: all but tanru-internal forethought connective medial marker.
$x_{1}$ is a cat/[puss/pussy/kitten] [feline animal] of species/breed $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is feline.
sumti link to attach sumti (default $x_{2}$) to a selbri; used in descriptions.
separates multiple linked sumti within a selbri; used in descriptions.
elidable terminator: end linked sumti in specified description.
$x_{1}$ is blue [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is good/beneficial/nice/[acceptable] for $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
sumti place tag: tag 2nd sumti place.
sumti place tag: tag 3rd sumti place.
sumti place tag: tag 5th sumti place.
tanru inversion operator; "... of type ..."; allows modifier trailing sumti without sumti links.
$x_{1}$ tries/attempts/makes an effort to do/attain $x_{2}$ (event/state/property) by actions/method $x_{3}$.
identity selbri; = sign; $x_{1}$ identically equals $x_{2}$, $x_{3}$, etc.; attached sumti refer to same thing.
n-ary mathematical operator: plus; addition operator; [(((a + b) + c) + ...)].
convert mathematical expression (mex) operator to a selbri/tanru component.
elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).
convert sumti to selbri/tanru element; $x_{1}$ is specific to [sumti] in aspect $x_{2}$.
elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
$x_{1}$ walks/strides/paces on surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$.
convert tense/modal (tagged) place to 1st place; 1st place moves to extra FA place (fai).
quantified selbri: convert 1 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is first among $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
contrary scalar negator: other than ...; not ...; a scale or set is implied.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of milk from source $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is lactic/dairy.
$x_{1}$ is a/the tooth [body-part] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is dental.
$x_1$ (nu) is an event in which $x_2$ teaches $x_3$ facts $x_4$ (du'u) about $x_5$ by means $x_6$; $x_1$ is a lesson given by $x_2$ to $x_3$.
valsi.notes: See also {ctuca}. This lujvo is regular.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a trap/restraint with $x_{2}$ being captured/restrained by $x_{3}$ (object/event).
$l_1$ steals $l_2$ from $l_3$, which is a crime according to $z_2$.
$g_1$ is a row (group) showing common property (ka) $g_2$ due to set $g_3$ linked by relations $g_4$.
$g_1=m_1$ is a complete set showing common property (ka) $g_2$, complete by standard $m_3$.
$l_1=m_1$ is a tractor pulling $l_2$.
$s_1=d_1$ is a pendulum oscillating at rate/frequency $s_2$, suspended from $d_2$ by/at/with joint $d_3$.
$t_1=n_1$ is a regent/monarch of $t_2$ by standard $n_2$.
$x_1=v_2$ is a tear/tear fluid of $x_2=v_1$.
$x_3=b_1$ is ill/sick/diseased with symptoms $x_2=b_2$ from disease $x_1=b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a rack used to hang $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a light source which illuminates $x_{2}$ with light $x_{3}$.
$t_1=c_2$ is a shade/blind for blocking light coming from/through $c_3$
$x_1$ is a sunflower of species/variety $x_2$.
$c_1=r_1$ is a small rock of type $r_2$ from location $r_3$, small by standard $c_3$. $c_1$ is gravel.
$x_1$ is hay of species $x_2$
$s_1$ is the grave/tomb of $m_1=s_2$.
$s_1$ is a structure of parts $s_2$ as a monument/memorial to $m_3$.
$j_1$ is a writing desk of material $j_2$, supported by legs/base/pedestal $j_3$, used by writer $c_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a farming community with members $x_{2}$.
$g_1$ is a mask covering the face of $g_2=f_2$.
$x_1=d_1=c_1$ is a sword / long knife weapon for use against $x_2=d_2$ by $x_3$ with blade of material $d_3$ long by standard $c_3$.
$x_1$ is an owl of species $x_2$
valsi.notes: Synonymous with {glauka}. This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is an evil spirit / demon
$x_1$ is a coward in activity $x_2$ (event) by standard $x_3$.
$n_1$ is an event at which $c_1$ eat(s) $c_2$.
quantified selbri: convert many to cardinal; $x_{1}$ is a set with many members $x_{2}$ of total set $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an article/descriptor labelling description $x_{2}$ (text) in language $x_{3}$ with semantics $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu. 'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

valsi.definition: start grammatical quotation; quoted text should be grammatical on its own.
start questionable/out-of-context quote; text should be Lojban words, but needn't be grammatical.
quote next word only; quotes a single Lojban word (not a cmavo compound or tanru).
delimited non-Lojban quotation; the result treated as a block of text.
the number/evaluated expression; convert number/operand/evaluated math expression to sumti.
descriptor: the one, which (is / does) ... / those, which (are / do) ...
valsi.notes: Terminated with {ku}. Under the xorlo reform, {lo} converts a selbri to a sumti in a generic way. In particular, lo broda = {zo'e} noi broda.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a bear/ursoid of species/breed $x_{2}$.
veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) that is(are) ...
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains butter/oleo/margarine/shortening from source $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (adjective:) $x_1$ is buttery; an edible fat, solid but spreadable at normal temperatures; dairy butter (= {ladmatne}). See also {grasu}, {kruji}.

valsi.definition: non-veridical descriptor: the set of those described as ..., treated as a set.
veridical descriptor: the set of those that really are ..., treated as a set.
$x_{1}$ [member] is ordinary/common/typical/usual in property $x_{2}$ (ka) among members of $x_{3}$ (set).
valsi.notes: Also: $x_2$ is a normal/common/ordinary/typical property among set $x_3$ (= selterfadni for reordered places); also regular, (mabla forms:) banal, trite, vulgar; ($x_3$ is complete set). See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tcaci}, {cnano}.

valsi.definition: veridical descriptor: the typical one(s) who really is(are) ...
non-veridical descriptor: the stereotype of those described as ...
digit/number: 3 (digit) [three].
digit/number: 4 (digit) [four].
digit/number: 5 (digit) [five].
number: all of.
number: at least some of.
digit/number: each, all.
digit/number: at least (some); no less than.
digit/number: radix (number base) point; default decimal.
the members of the set/components of the mass; converts another description type to individuals.
elidable terminator: end of sumti qualifiers; usually elidable except before a sumti.
$x_{1}$ is a sign/symbol/signal representing/referring/signifying/meaning $x_{2}$ to observer $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ signifies $x_2$; (adjective:) $x_1$ is significant/meaningful/of import; signal an action (= {sniti'i}), connotation (= se {sibyti'isni}, {sibyti'ismu}). See also {lerfu}, {tcita}, {barna}, {mifra}, {smuni}.

glossword.sense: serve as a sign or symbol of

valsi.definition: the referent of (indirect pointer); uses the referent of a sumti as the desired sumti.
the symbol for (indirect discourse); uses the symbol/word(s) for a sumti as the desired sumti.
extracts a concrete sumti from an unspecified abstraction; equivalent to le nu/su'u [sumti] co'e.
the set with members; converts another description type to a set of the members.
the mass composed of; converts another description type to a mass composed of the members.
sumti qualifier: the sequence made from set or composed of elements/components; order is vague.
pro-sumti: the last sumti, as determined by back-counting rules.
pro-sumti: a recent sumti before the last one, as determined by back-counting rules.
elidable terminator: end vocative (often elidable).
$x_{1}$ [rules/methods] is a logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $x_{2}$ (du'u).
$x_{1}$ is a/the language/dialect used by $x_{2}$ to express/communicate $x_{3}$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s) & others unspecified.
pro-sumti: you the listener & others unspecified.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #1 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #2 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #3 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #4 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #5 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #6 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #7 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #8 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #9 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #10 (specified by goi).
sumti assignment; used to define/assign ko'a/fo'a series pro-sumti; Latin 'sive'.
valsi.notes: Note: Directionality of assignment may be ambiguous. {ca'e} on the "toward" side may be used to disambiguate.

valsi.definition: logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 1 (usually restricted).
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 2 (usually restricted).
pro-sumti: repeats 1st place of main bridi of this sentence.
pro-sumti: repeats 2nd place of main bridi of this sentence.
pro-sumti: repeats 3rd place of main bridi of this sentence.
pro-sumti: repeats 4th place of main bridi of this sentence.
pro-sumti: repeats 5th place of main bridi of this sentence.
pro-sumti: a remote past sumti, before all other in-use backcounting sumti.
pro-sumti: the typical sumti value for this place in this relationship; affects truth value.
pro-sumti: fills a sumti place, deleting it from selbri place structure;changes selbri semantics.
pro-sumti: a recent utterance.
pro-sumti: a remote past utterance; "She couldn't have known that IT would be true.".
pro-sumti: the next utterance.
pro-sumti: a near future utterance.
pro-sumti: remote future utterance; "He'll tell you tomorrow. IT will be a doozy.".
pro-sumti: this utterance.
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
elidable terminator: end grammatical quotation; seldom elidable except at end of text.
attitudinal: intent - indecision - rejection/refusal.
the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
self vocative: self-introduction - denial of identity; identifies speaker.
elidable terminator: end GOI relative phrases; usually elidable in non-complex phrases.
selbri variable assignment; assigns broda series pro-bridi to a selbri.
letteral for g.
pro-bridi: repeats a recent bridi (usually not the last 2).
pro-bridi: repeats a remote past bridi.
pro-bridi: repeats the next to last bridi.
pro-bridi: repeats a future bridi, normally the next one.
pro-bridi: repeats the current bridi.
pro-bridi: repeats the bridi in which this one is embedded.
letteral for m.
flag GOhA to indicate pro-assignment context updating for all pro-assigns in referenced bridi.
$x_{1}$ makes/assembles/builds/manufactures/creates $x_{2}$ out of materials/parts/components $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Should not be used to express causation. Cf. {cupra}, {larcu}, {rutni}, {finti}, {gundi}.

valsi.definition: elliptical/unspecified bridi relationship.
elliptical/unspecified modal.
discursive: reciprocal sumti marker; indicates a reciprocal relationship between sumti.
elidable terminator: end discursive bridi or mathematical precedence;usually elidable.
pseudo-quantifier binding a variable within an abstraction that represents an open place.
discursive: cancel pro-sumti/pro-bridi assignments.
discursive: paragraph break; resume previous topic.
$x_{1}$ is equal/congruent to/as much as $x_{2}$ in property/dimension/quantity $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Same in quantity/quality (not necessarily in identity); 'analogy' may be expressed as the equivalence of two properties of similarity (ka $x_1$ simsa $x_2$) and (ka $x_3$ simsa $x_4$). See also {du'i}, {satci}, {frica}, {simsa}, {mintu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ talks to you (i.e. whoever $x_1$ is addressing) about $x_2$ in language $x_3$
valsi.notes: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is a second person pronoun in language $c_4$.
logically quantified predicate variable: some selbri 1.
elidable terminator: end NOI relative clause; always elidable, but preferred in complex clauses.
non-restrictive relative clause; attaches subordinate bridi with incidental information.
restrictive relative clause; attaches subordinate bridi with identifying information to a sumti.
restrictive relative phrase marker: which is associated with ...; loosest associative/possessive.
restrictive relative phrase marker: which is specific to ...; normal possessive physical/legal.
$x_{1}$ (ka) is specific/particular/specialized/[special]/a defining property of $x_{2}$ among $x_{3}$ (set).
valsi.notes: [$x_2$ are members/individuals of a subset of $x_3$; object whose association is specific/defining of a subset or individuals (= {tecra'a}, also cf. cmavo list {po'e}, [$x_2$ is also special to $x_1$]); also: especially/strongly/specifically associated]; ($x_3$ is completely specified set)]; See also {srana}, se {ponse}, {ckini}, {tcila}, {tutra}.

valsi.definition: restrictive relative phrase marker: which belongs to ... ; inalienable possession.
$x_{1}$ is a/the arm [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: branch with strength].
valsi.notes: Also elbow (= {bircidni}), wrist (= {xanterjo'e}), appendage (but jimca, rebla preferred). See also {jimca}, {janco}, {xance}, {rebla}.

valsi.definition: restrictive appositive phrase marker: which is the same thing as.
non-restrictive relative phrase marker: which incidentally is associated with ...
non-restrictive appositive phrase marker: which incidentally is the same thing as ...
joins relative clauses which apply to the same sumti.
non-veridical restrictive clause used to form complicated le-like descriptions using "ke'a".
elidable: end of sumti in simple bridi; in compound bridi, separates common trailing sumti.
$x_{1}$ is white/very-light colored [color adjective].
valsi.notes: Pale forms of other colors are a compound of white; e.g. pink (= {labyxu'e}, {xunblabi}) (whereas kandi is used for pale = dimness, lack of intensity). See also {skari}, {xekri}, {grusi}, {kandi}, {manku}, {carmi}, {bakri}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

valsi.definition: joins relative clause/phrase to complete complex or logically connected sumti in afterthought.
$x_{1}$ is a man/men; $x_{1}$ is a male humanoid person [not necessarily adult].
valsi.notes: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use remna or prenu). See also {ninmu}, {remna}, {prenu}, {makcu}, {nanla}, {bersa}.

valsi.definition: marks end of logical prenex quantifiers/topic identification and start of sentence bridi.
sumti place tag: tag 1st sumti place.
sumti place tag: place structure number/tag question.
$x_{1}$ [donor] gives/donates gift/present $x_{2}$ to recipient/beneficiary $x_{3}$ [without payment/exchange].
valsi.notes: Also grants; $x_3$ is a receiver (= {terdu'a} for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydu'a}, {posyseldu'a} for unambiguous semantics). See also {benji}, {muvdu}, {canja}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {friti}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {cnemu}, {prali}.

valsi.definition: sumti place tag: tag a sumti moved out of numbered place structure; used in modal conversions.
$x_{1}$ sees/views/perceives visually $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is visual; $x_3$ can include ambient lighting, background, etc. which may affect what is perceived; note that English "see" often means "look" or a more generic "observe", or even "understand, know". See also {catlu}, {jvinu}, {kanla}, {minra}, {simlu}, {djuno}, {jimpe}, {zgana}, {ganse}.

glossword.sense: perceive visually, not implying mental processing

valsi.definition: convert selbri to nonce modal/sumti tag.
$x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.
elidable terminator: end nonce conversion of selbri to modal; usually elidable.
$x_{1}$ uses/employs $x_{2}$ [tool, apparatus, machine, agent, acting entity, material] for purpose $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also utilize; $x_2$ is useful/used productively by $x_1$ to do $x_3$ (= {selpli} for reordered places); hire/employ (= {le'ipli}, {lejyplicu'a}). (cf. {tutci}, {cabra}, {minji}, {gasnu}, {zukte} for $x_2$, cmavo list {pi'o}, {sazri}, {jibri})

valsi.definition: pilno modal, 2nd place (instrumental) tool/machine/apparatus/acting entity; using (tool) ...
pilno modal, 1st place used by ...
klama modal, 1st place gone to by ...
klama modal, 2nd place with destination ...
klama modal, 3rd place with origin ...
klama modal, 4th place via route ...
klama modal, 5th place by transport mode ...
jalge modal, 1st place resultingly; therefore result ...
jalge modal, 2nd place (event causal) results because of ...
gasnu modal, 1st place agent/actor case tag with active agent ...
zukte modal, 3rd place purposefully; (as an action) with goal ...
rinka modal, 1st place (phys./mental) causal because ...
krinu modal, 1st place (justified by) justifiably; because of reason ...
mukti modal, 1st place because of motive ...
nibli modal, 1st place logically; logically because ...
rinka modal, 2nd place (phys./mental) causal therefore ...
$x_{1}$ (event/state) effects/physically causes effect $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is a material condition for $x_2$; $x_1$ gives rise to $x_2$. See also {gasnu}, {krinu}, {nibli}, te {zukte}, se {jalge}, {bapli}, {jitro}, cmavo list {ri'a}, {mukti}, {ciksi}, {xruti}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).
valsi.notes: See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (action/event/state) motivates/is a motive/incentive for action/event $x_{2}$, per volition of $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also; $x_3$ is motivated to bring about result/goal/objective $x_2$ by $x_1$ (= {termu'i} for reordered places); (note that 'under conditions' BAI may apply and be appropriately added to the main predicate level or within the $x_2$ action level). (cf. cmavo list {mu'i}, {nibli}, te {zukte} - generally better for 'goal', se {jalge}, {krinu}, {rinka}, {ciksi}, {djica}, {xlura})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ logically necessitates/entails/implies action/event/state $x_{2}$ under rules/logic system $x_{3}$.
left mathematical bracket.
right mathematical bracket.
bangu modal, 1st place in language ...
bapli modal, 1st place (forced by) forcedly; compelled by force ...
start of multiple utterance scope; used for logical/non-logical/ordinal joining of sentences.
elidable terminator: end multiple utterance scope; seldom elidable.
$x_{1}$ (agent) expresses/says $x_{2}$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $x_{3}$ via expressive medium $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also says. See also {bacru}, {tavla}, {casnu}, {spuda}, cmavo list {cu'u}, {bangu}, {dapma}, {jufra}, {pinka}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ invents/creates/composes/authors $x_{2}$ for function/purpose $x_{3}$ from existing elements/ideas $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is creative/inventive. See also cmavo list {fi'e}, {ciska}, {pemci}, {zbasu}, {larcu}, specific works of authorship, {prosa}, {skina}.

valsi.definition: finti modal, 1st place (creator) created by ...
zmadu modal, 1st place (a greater) exceeded by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
mleca modal, 1st place (a lesser) undercut by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
$x_{1}$ is less than $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni) by amount $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also negative (= {nonme'a}). See also cmavo list {me'a}, cmavo list {su'o}, {jdika}, {zmadu}, {traji}.

valsi.definition: zmadu modal, 2nd place (relative!) more than ...; usually a sumti modifier.
mleca modal, 2nd place (relative!) less than ...; usually a sumti modifier.
basti modal, 2nd place instead of ...
ckilu modal, 1st place on the scale ...
detri modal, 1st place (for letters) dated ... ; attaches date stamp.
dunli modal, 1st place (equalled by) equally; as much as ...
tense/modal: set/use tense default; establishes new open scope space/time/modal reference base.
links terms into an afterthought termset.
$x_1$ has form $x_2$, similar in form to $x_3$ in property/quality $x_4$.
tamsmi modal, 1st place (like)/(in manner 2) resembling ...; sharing ideal form ...
valsi.notes: {tamsmi} is $x_1$ resembles $x_2$ sharing ideal form/shape $x_3$ in property $x_4$

valsi.definition: fasnu modal, 1st place (non-causal) in the event of ...

glossword.sense: varying through time to the same proportion that

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (event) is an event that happens/occurs/takes place; $x_{1}$ is an incident/happening/occurrence.
srana modal, 1st place pertained to by ... (generally more specific).
$x_{1}$ pertains to/is germane/relevant to/concerns/is related/associated with/is about $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is a question of/treats of $x_2$; can be symmetric, although $x_1$ is conventionally more specific or constrained in scope than $x_2$. See also cmavo list {ra'a}, {ckini}, {ponse}, {steci}.

valsi.definition: krasi modal, 1st place from source/origin/starting point ...
$x_{1}$ (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of $x_{2}$ (object/event/process).
valsi.notes: Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) $x_1$ is initial. See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.

valsi.definition: location tense distance: near to ... ; there at ...; a medium/small distance from ...
location tense relation/direction; leftwards/to the left of ...
$x_{1}$ is to the left/left-hand side of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$. See also cmavo list {zu'a}, {pritu}, {mlana}, {crane}, {trixe}, {farna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is in the past of/earlier than/before $x_{2}$ in time sequence; $x_{1}$ is former; $x_{2}$ is latter.
valsi.notes: Time ordering only (use lidne otherwise); aorist in that $x_1$ may overlap in time with $x_2$ as long as it starts before, $x_1$ starts before $x_2$ but is continuing during $x_2$ (= {cfaprucabna}); non-aorist before, i.e. $x_1$ is over/ended before $x_2$ starts (= {fampru}), $x_1$ is completed before $x_2$ starts (= {mulpru}). See also {lidne}, {balvi}, {cabna}, {farna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is current at/in the present of/during/concurrent/simultaneous with $x_{2}$ in time.
valsi.notes: (default $x_2$ is the present resulting in:) $x_1$ is now; time relationship only, 'aorist' claiming simultaneity does not mean one event does not extend into the past or future of the other. See also {zvati}, {balvi}, {purci}, cmavo list {ca}, cmavo list {ca'a}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is in the future of/later than/after $x_{2}$ in time sequence; $x_{1}$ is latter; $x_{2}$ is former.
valsi.notes: Also sequel, succeed, successor, follow, come(s) after; time ordering only (use {lidne} otherwise); aorist in that $x_1$ may overlap in time with $x_2$ as long as it extends afterwards; non-aorist future (= {cfabalvi}); (default $x_2$ is the space time reference, whereupon:) $x_1$ will occur. See also {lidne}, {cabna}, {purci}, {farna}.

valsi.definition: location tense relation/direction; coincident with/at the same place as; space equivalent of ca.
time tense distance: instantaneous-to-short distance in time.
time tense interval: an instantaneous/tiny/short amount of time.
dimensionality of space interval tense: 2-space interval; throughout an area.
dimensionality of space interval tense: 3-space interval; throughout a space.
dimensionality of space interval tense: 4-space interval; throughout a spacetime.
mark motions in space-time.
manri modal, 1st place (by standard 2) in reference frame ...
converts number to an objectively quantified tense interval modifier; defaults to time tense.
tense interval modifier: continuously; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
tense interval modifier: regularly; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
tense interval modifier: characteristically/typically; tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
tense interval modifier: habitually; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
tense interval modifier: occasional/intermittent/discontinuous; defaults as time tense.
tense interval modifier: irregularly/aperiodically; tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
time tense interval: the whole of time.
location tense interval: the whole of space.
converts number to an objectively quantified ordinal tense interval modifier; defaults to time.
interval event contour: in anticipation of ...; until ... ; inchoative ----| |.
interval event contour: during ...; continuative |-----|.
interval event contour: in the aftermath of ...; since ...; retrospective/perfect | |----.
interval event contour: at the starting point of ...; initiative >|< |.
interval event contour: at the ending point of ... even if not done; cessative | >< |.
event contour for a temporary halt and ensuing pause in a process.
event contour for resumption of a paused process.
interval event contour: continuing too long after natural end of ...; superfective | ---->.

glossword.sense: at the present time, as in the past

valsi.definition: interval event contour: at the instantaneous point of ...; achievative/perfective; point event >|<.
mark space interval distributive aspects; labels interval tense modifiers as location-oriented.
location tense relation/direction; north of.
time tense: was going to; (tense/modal).
tense: refers to current space/time reference absolutely.
modal aspect: innate capability; possibly unrealized.
modal aspect: can but has not; unrealized potential.
modal aspect: can and has; demonstrated potential.
modal aspect: actuality/ongoing event.
non-logical interval connective: ordered from ... to ...
tense interval modifier: twice; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
non-logical connective: cross product; Cartesian product of sets.
tense/modal question.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought x but not y.
start forethought termset construct; marks start of place structure set with logical connection.
elidable terminator: end forethought termset; usually elidable except with following sumti.
klani modal, 1st place (amount) quantifying ...; being a quantity of ...
location tense relation/direction; arriving at/directly towards ...
location tense relation/direction; departing from/directly away from ...
location tense relation/direction; nearer than .../inward/approaching from ...
location tense relation/direction; beyond/outward/receding from ...
abstractor: generalized event abstractor; $x_{1}$ is state/process/achievement/activity of [bridi].
abstractor: achievement (event) abstractor; $x_{1}$ is the event-as-a-point/achievement of [bridi].
abstractor: process (event) abstractor; $x_{1}$ is process of [bridi] proceeding in stages $x_{2}$.
abstractor: activity (event) abstractor; $x_{1}$ is abstract activity of [bridi] composed of $x_{2}$.
abstractor: state (event) abstractor; $x_{1}$ is continuous state of [bridi] being true.
convert sumti to mex operand; sample use in story arithmetic: [3 apples] + [3 apples] = what.
abstractor: quantity/amount abstractor; $x_{1}$ is quantity/amount of [bridi] measured on scale $x_{2}$.
abstractor: truth-value abstractor; $x_{1}$ is truth value of [bridi] under epistemology $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ knows fact(s) $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$ by epistemology $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= {tadjyju'o}). 'know/familiar with' - {se} {slabu}, {na'e} {cnino}, {na'e} {fange}. See also {du'o}, {krici}, {jinvi}, {cilre}, {certu}, {facki}, {jijnu}, {jimpe}, {senpi}, {smadi}, {kakne}, {birti}, {mipri}, {morji}, {saske}, {viska}.

valsi.definition: abstractor: predication/bridi abstractor; $x_{1}$ is predication [bridi] expressed in sentence $x_{2}$.
discursive: marks word serving as focus of indirect question: "I know WHO went to the store".
abstractor: experience abstractor; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s experience of [bridi] (participant or observer).
abstractor: idea/concept abstractor; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s concept of [bridi].
abstractor: generalized abstractor (how); $x_{1}$ is [bridi] as a non-specific abstraction of type $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a doorway/gateway/access way between $x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$ of structure $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Note: emphasis on route nature; solid door (= {vrogai}/{vrobi'u}/{vrozu'itci}). See also {canko}, {ganlo}, {kalri}, {murta}, {pagre}, {bitmu}, {kuspe}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (event) often/frequently/commonly/customarily occurs/recurs by standard $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: See also {rirci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {rapli}, {krefu}, {lakne}, cmavo list {piso'iroi} and similar compounds.

valsi.definition: interval event contour: at the natural ending point of ...; completive | >|<.
$x_1=fe_1$ is the ashes of $x_3=fa_2$, combusted by fire $x_2=fa_1$.
$x_{1}$(s) is/are waste product(s) [left to waste] by $x_{2}$ (event/activity).
valsi.notes: Also shit, crap; agentive wasting (= {fesygau}, {fesyzu'e}). See also {xaksu}, {kalci}, {pinca}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a fire/flame in fuel $x_{2}$ burning-in/reacting-with oxidizer $x_{3}$ (default air/oxygen).

$x_{1}$ is a metaphor [of affix compound] with meaning [of affix compound] $x_{2}$ with argument [of affix compound] $x_{3}$ with affix compound $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is the tanru/metaphor construct of complex word/affix compound/lujvo $x_{4}$
valsi.notes: x4 is a compound word that is composed of various morphological/lexical "parts" that represents the underlying tanru/construct x1. Since this word is language-independent, the metaphor construct need not be successively-binary, as it is in Lojban. x1 is the tanru construct that underlies/is used to interpret/analyze/"break apart" lujvo x4.

glossword.word: morpholexical part of a compound word

valsi.definition: $s_1=b_1$ is a great soldier of army $s_2$ great in property $b_2$ (ka) by standard $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a soldier/warrior/fighter of army $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is great/grand in property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Indicates a subjective greatness, as compared to the objective standard implied for {barda}; (synonyms, possibly requiring tanru:) extraordinary, illustrious, magnificent, impressive, awesome, grandiose, august, inspiring, special, majestic, distinguished, eminent, splendor, stately, imposing (all generally {zabna}); terrible ({mabla}). See also {barda}, {nobli}, {se} {sinma}, {pluja}, {misno}, {vajni}, {fasnu}, {cizra}, {traji}, {mutce}, {se} {manci}.

valsi.definition: $t_1=j_1$ listens to/pays attention to sound $t_2=j_2$ with ambient background $t_3$.
$x_{1}$ hears $x_{2}$ against background/noise $x_{3}$; $x_{2}$ is audible; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is aural.
$x_{1}$ is attentive towards/attends/tends/pays attention to object/affair $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ comes/goes to $x_2$ from $x_3$ via route $x_4$ using car $x_5$
valsi.notes: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$
$x_1$ is a beetle of species $x_2$.
valsi.notes: Not to be confused with {ckacinki}; Cf. {kokcinela}, {kurkuli}, {gusycinki}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a shell/husk [hard, protective covering] around $x_{2}$ composed of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ travels/journeys/goes/moves via route $x_{2}$ using means/vehicle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a traveller.
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly); See also {bajra}, {cadzu}, {cpare}, {tcana}, {klama}, {cliva}, {pluta}, {limna}, {muvdu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ leaves/goes away/departs/parts/separates from $x_{2}$ via route $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ leaves behind/takes leave of $x_2$. See also {litru}, {canci}, {vimcu}, {lebna}, {muvdu}.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is a building housing school $c_1$ teaching subject $c_3$ to audience $c_4$.
$x_{1}$ is an insect/arthropod of species $x_{2}$; [bug/beetle].
$c_2$ is a prayer of believer $c_1=l_2$ for deity $c_3$ in medium $c_4$ according to religion $l_3$.
logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought and.
$m_1$ is a doctor for animal $m_2=d_1$ of species $d_2$ for ailment $m_3$ using treatment $m_4$.
$x_{1}$ is an animal/creature of species $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is biologically animate.
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered places) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}). See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

valsi.definition: $d_1=b_1=l_1$ is tomorrow; $d_1=b_1=l_1$ is the day following $b_2=l_2$, day standard $d_3$.
$b_1=l_1$ is next after $b_2=l_2$ in sequence $l_3$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal.
$x_1$ is a long knife
valsi.notes: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is long in dimension/direction $x_{2}$ (default longest dimension) by measurement standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a knife (tool) for cutting $x_{2}$, with blade of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a weapon/arms for use against $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
$f_1=s_2$ is a bill specifying $f_2$ (state/event) for community $f_3$ under conditions $f_4$, proposed/drafted by $s_1$.
$x_1$ is a suggestion made by $x_2$ to audience $x_3$
$x_{1}$ (agent) suggests/proposes idea/action $x_{2}$ to audience $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ (event) inspires $x_{2}$ in/among $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Event which inspires/suggests/is suggestive (= {faurti'i}, {sidyfau}). See also cmavo list {ti'i}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a law specifying $x_{2}$ (state/event) for community $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$ by lawgiver(s) $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is a legality; $x_2$ is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= {selfla} for reordered places). See also {javni}, {ritli}, {zekri}, {pulji}, {tinbe}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ desires/wants/wishes $x_{2}$ (event/state) for purpose $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: If desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in $x_2$ (or use lujvo = {po'edji}). See also {taske}, {xagji}, {mukti}, {nitcu}, {nelci}, {pacna}, {prami}, {rigni}, {trina}, {xebni}, {xlura}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is an eye of $x_2$ and has a blue iris
valsi.notes: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

valsi.definition: $x_1$ has blue eyes
valsi.notes: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

valsi.definition: $p_1=r_1$ is a steak/beefsteak (flat cut of beef) from cow/cattle/kine/ox $p_2=r_2=b_1$.
$x_1$ trespasses (illegally enters) into $x_2$, which is a crime according to $x_3$
valsi.notes: klama$_3$ through klama$_5$ dropped for being usually irrelevant to this concept; if need be they can be replaced with {teka'a}/{veka'a}/{xeka'a} or {ra'i}/{pu'ai}/{sepi'o}. See {zekri}, {nerkla}, {gutnerkla}

valsi.definition: polar opposite scalar negator.
To destination $x_{1}$ does $x_{2}$ go from $x_{3}$ via route $x_{4}$ by means $x_{5}$.
$c_1=k_1$ walks to $k_2$ from $k_3$ via route $k_4$ using limbs $k_5=c_3$ on surface $c_2$
$x_1$ is happier than $x_2$ about $x_3$ by amount $x_4$
valsi.notes: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is happy/merry/glad/gleeful about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$n_1$ is a passage where goer $k_1$ comes/goes to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5$.
$x_1$ is blueness
valsi.notes: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ [person/agent] is an agentive cause of event $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ does/brings about $x_{2}$.
$g_1$ feeds $c_1$ with food $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ replaces/substitutes for/instead of $x_{2}$ in circumstance $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a replacement/substitute.
$g_1$ (agent) replaces/substitutes $b_1$ for/instead of $b_2$ in circumstance $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is liquid/fluid, of composition/material including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Conditions include temperature and pressure. See also {cilmo}, {djacu}, {lumci}, {runta}, {pambe}, {sudga}, {gapci}, {sligu}, {flecu}, {jduli}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (event) modifies/alters/changes/transforms/converts $x_{2}$ into $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= {gafygau}, {gafyzu'e}). (cf. {stika} for non-resultative, {binxo} for not-necessarily causal change, {cenba} for non-resultative change; {zasni})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ eats/ingests/consumes (transitive verb) $x_{2}$.
$c_2$ is said by $c_1$ to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a religion of believers including $x_{2}$ sharing common beliefs/practices/tenets including $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also mythos, creed, traditional beliefs, $x_2$ people(s), adherents; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_3$ are religious/ecclesiastic in nature; $x_2$ is a believer in/of $x_1$, an adherent/follower of $x_1$ (= {seljda} for reordered places); $x_2$ is a practitioner of $x_3$ (= {selterjda} for reordered places); $x_3$ is a tenet/belief/ritual/creed of $x_1$/$x_2$ (= {terjda} for reordered places); priest/clerical (= {jdaca'i}, {jdaka'i}, {jdaja'a}); organized church/religion (= {be'ejda}); congregation (= {jdabe'e}, {jdagri}). See also {budjo}, {censa}, {cevni}, {crida}, {dadjo}, {jegvo}, {krici}, {latna}, {malsi}, {marde}, {muslo}, {pruxi}, {ranmi}, {ritli}, {xriso}, {zekri}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ shepherds flock $x_2$ composed of sheep $x_3$
valsi.notes: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ has control over/harnesses/manages/directs/conducts $x_{2}$ in $x_{3}$ (activity/event/performance).
valsi.notes: $x_2$ are aspects/individuals controlled within activity/event $x_3$; manage (= {selzuktro}, {selzukfu'e}, {gu'etro}, {gunfu'e}, {xaktro}, {xakfu'e}) (as distinct from manager/boss = {gunterbe'e}, {gunja'a}, {gunmi'e}, {gunca'i}). (cf. cmavo list {ji'o}, {bapli}, te {bende}, {gidva} - which does not necessarily control or command, {jatna}, {macnu}, {minde}, {ponse}, {ralju}, {rinka}, {sazri}, {turni}, {vlipa}, {xance}, {xlura})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a/the hand [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: manipulating tool, waldo].
$x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
valsi.notes: [also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (experiencer) increases/is incremented/augmented in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is superlative in property $x_{2}$ (ka), the $x_{3}$ extreme (ka; default ka zmadu) among set/range $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is $x_3$-est/utmost in $x_2$ among $x_4$; $x_1$ is the $x_3$ end of $x_4$; $x_1$ is extreme; $x_1$ is simply $x_3$. (cf. cmavo list {rai}, {jimte}, {milxe}, {mutce}, note contrast with milxe and mutce rather than with mleca and zmadu, which are values for $x_3$, {banli}, {curve}, {fanmo}, {krasi}, {manfo}, {prane})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is young/youthful [relatively short in elapsed duration] by standard $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also age (= {nilnalci'o}); (adjective:) $x_1$ is junior. See also {laldo}, {cnino}, {slabu}, {verba}.

valsi.definition: $z_1=c_1$ is younger than $z_2$ by amount $z_4$.
zmadu modal, 4th place (relative!) more than/exceeding by amount ...
mleca modal, 4th place (relative!) less than by amount ...
$xa_1=z_1$ is better than $z_2$ for $xa_2$ by standard $xa_3$, by amount $z_4$.
$t_1=x_1$ is the best among set/range $t_4$ for $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is black/extremely dark-colored [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is born to $x_{2}$ at time $x_{3}$ [birthday] and place $x_{4}$ [birthplace]; $x_{1}$ is native to (fo) $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ bears/gives birth to $x_1$; also $x_3$: natal day. See also {fange}, {gutra}, {rorci}, {mamta}, {salci}, {citsi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a volitional entity employing means/taking action $x_{2}$ for purpose/goal $x_{3}$/to end $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also acting at, undertaking, doing; agentive cause with volition/purpose; also $x_3$ objective, end. See also cmavo list {zu'e}, {bapli}, {gunka}, {jalge}, {krinu}, {mukti}, {rinka}, {snuti}, {gasnu}, {fasnu}, {minji}, {prenu}, {ciksi}, {jibri}, {pilno}, {pluta}, {tadji}, {tutci}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a lion/[lioness] of species/breed $x_{2}$.

See also {denmi}, {gusni}, {kandi}, {ruble}, {skari}, {tilju}, {tsali}, {mutce}, {blabi}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

valsi.notes: Bloody (British sense), fucking, shit, goddamn. See also {zabna}, {xlali}, {palci}, {dapma}, {funca}, {ganti}, {ganxo}, {gletu}, {gutra}, {kalci}, {pinca}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}, {zargu}.

$x_{1}$ is a/the heart [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [emotional/shape metaphors are NOT culturally neutral].
$x_{1}$ burns/[ignites/is flammable/inflammable] at temperature $x_{2}$ in atmosphere $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Default $x_2$/$x_3$ to normal temperatures in air; ignite (= {jelcfa}), flammable/inflammable (usually = {jelka'e} or {jelfrili}). See also {fagri}, {kijno}, {sigja}, {livla}, {sacki}.

valsi.definition: discursive: newly introduced information - previously introduced information.
discursive: newly introduced information - previously introduced information.

vocative: roger (ack) - negative acknowledge; used to acknowledge offers and thanks.

vocative: over and out (end discussion).
unconditional end of text; outside regular grammar; used for computer input.
logical connective: sumti afterthought or.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal or (with gi).
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal conditional/only if (with gi).
$x_{1}$ is rich/wealthy in goods/possessions/property/aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ takes/gets/gains/obtains/seizes/[removes] $x_{2}$ (object/property) from $x_{3}$ (possessor).
valsi.notes: Also confiscate, appropriate. Acquire with volition such that $x_1$ gains possession; $x_3$ is possessor and not merely source, alienation is implied. (cf. {punji}, {cpacu} where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, {vimcu} for alienation where $x_1$ need not gain possession, {canci}, {cliva})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ owes $x_{2}$ in debt/obligation to creditor $x_{3}$ in return for $x_{4}$ [service, loan]; $x_{1}$ is a debtor.
marks the following connective as joining termsets.
$x_{1}$ is a woman/women; $x_{1}$ is a female humanoid person [not necessarily adult].
valsi.notes: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use remna or prenu). See also {nanmu}, {remna}, {prenu}, {makcu}, {nixli}.

valsi.definition: logical connective: sumti afterthought and.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal connective question (with gi).
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought question (with gi).
$x_{1}$ chooses/selects $x_{2}$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $x_{3}$ (complete set).
$x_{1}$ (physical object) is a list/catalog/register of sequence/set $x_{2}$ in order $x_{3}$ in medium $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also roll, log. ($x_2$ is completely specified); (cf. {porsi}, {girzu}, {cmima} for mental objects wherein order is of varying importance; some manifested order is intrinsic to a physical list, but the specific order may be incidental and not intentional/purposeful)

valsi.definition: non-logical connective: ordered sequence link; "and then", forming a sequence.
non-logical connective: in common with; along with (unmixed).
convert number to cardinality selbri; $x_{1}$ is a mass formed from a set $x_{2}$ of n members, one or more of which is/are $x_{3}$, measured relative to the set $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: [$x_1$ is a mass with N components $x_3$ composing set $x_2$; $x_2$ is an n-tuple ($x_2$ is completely specified) (= {selmei} for reordered places); $x_1$ forms an n-some; $x_3$ (not necessarily a complete enumeration) are among the members of $x_2$); See also {cmima}, {gunma}, cmavo list {moi}.

valsi.definition: non-logical connective: respectively; unmixed ordered distributed association.

non-logical connective: intersection of sets.
$x_{1}$(s) (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) discuss(es)/talk(s) about topic/subject $x_{2}$.

non-logical interval connective: ordered components: ... center, ... range surrounding center.
$x_{1}$ stands [is vertically oriented] on surface $x_{2}$ supported by limbs/support/pedestal $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is standing; $x_1$ stands up; $x_1$ is erect/vertical/upright; $x_1$ bows/bends over (= {krosa'i}, {krosa'ibi'o}, {plosa'i}); frame of reference is (approximate) perpendicularity to the surface, and not to a gravity field. See also {kamju}, {sraji}, {tuple}, {zbepi}, {sarji}.

valsi.definition: closed interval bracket marker; mod. intervals in non-logical connectives; include boundaries.
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$ (something being blocked).
valsi.notes: As a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane. $x_{3}$ is blocked by $x_{1}$. $x_{2}$ is inaccessible. See also {kalri}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}, {zunti}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is open/ajar/not shut permitting passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: As a doorway. $x_{3}$ is given access to $x_{2}$ through portal $x_{1}$. See also {ganlo}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}.

valsi.definition: elidable terminator: terminate numeral or letteral string.

time tense: will have been; (tense/modal).
$x_{1}$ thinks/opines $x_{2}$ [opinion] (du'u) is true about subject/issue $x_{3}$ on grounds $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also cmavo list {pe'i}, {djuno}, {krici}, {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {senpi}, {sidbo}, {birti}, {pinka}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true/assumed about subject $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: "without evidence" refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction. See also {jinvi}, {djuno}, {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.

valsi.definition: logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought or.
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought or (with gi).

logical connective: tanru-internal forethought whether-or-not (with gi).

valsi.notes: $x_1$ (or $x_3$) is synergistic in $x_4$; also network; $x_2$ also relations, rules; $x_3$ also elements (set completely specified); $x_4$ systemic functions/properties. See also cmavo list {ci'e}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {stura}, {tadji}, {munje}, {farvi}, {ganzu}, {judri}, {julne}, {klesi}, {morna}, {tcana}.

valsi.notes: Conditions may include lighting, background, etc.. See also {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {cinta}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xunre}, {zirpu}, {carmi}, {kandi}, {xekri}, {blabi}.

$x_{1}$ needs/requires/is dependent on/[wants] necessity $x_{2}$ for purpose/action/stage of process $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: No implication of lack. See also {banzu}, {cidja}, {claxu}, {pindi}, {xebni}, {sarcu}, {lacri}, {djica}, {taske}, {xagji}.

valsi.notes: ($x_2$ is an event, usually a point event); also: resuming $x_4$. See also {dicra}, {fanmo}, {sisti}, {fliba}, {pandi}.
