valsi.notes: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$. See also cmavo list {ri'u}, {mlana}, {crane}, {trixe}, {farna}, {zunle}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is high/up/upward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also upper; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself. See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$x_{1}$ is directly/vertically above/upwards-from $x_{2}$ in gravity/frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a point/instant/moment [0-dimensional shape/form] in/on/at time/place $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a ring/annulus/torus/circle [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, inside diam. $x_{3}$, outside diam. $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also ellipse, oval (= {jincla}); (usage has been for near-circles, such as tight spirals, even if not closed loops). Also band, belt, encircle (= {jinsru}). See also {clupa}, {cukla}, {dasri}, {karli}, {sovda}, {sruri}, {konju}.

valsi.definition: digit/number: plus sign; positive number; default any positive.
digit/number: minus sign; negative number); default any negative.
digit/number: repeating digits (of a decimal) follow.
digit/number: number comma; thousands.
digit/number: imaginary i; square root of -1.
valsi.notes: Acts as a number punctuation mark (separating the real and the imaginary parts of a complex number); for example "ci ka'o re" means 3 + 2i. See also: {kau'o}, {ka'o'ai}, {ka'o'ei}.

valsi.definition: digit/number: pi (approximately 3.1416...); the constant defined by the ratio of the circumference to the diameter of all circles.
digit/number: exponential e (approx 2.71828...).
n-ary mathematical operator: times; multiplication operator; [(((a * b) * c) * ...)].
prefixed to a mex operator to indicate high priority.
binary mathematical operator: to the power; exponential; [a to the b power].
elidable terminator: end mathematical (mex) forethought (Polish) expression; often elidable.
unary mathematical operator: additive inverse; [- a].
n-ary mathematical operator: minus; subtraction operator; [(((a - b) - c) - ...)].
forethought flag for mathematical expression (mex) Polish (forethought) operator.
$x_1$ is less than or equal to $x_2$
$x_1$ is greater than or equal to $x_2$.
$d_1$ is/are geometrically similar/has the same shape as $d_2$.
valsi.notes: Objects that have the same shape or one has the same shape as the other's mirror image are called geometrically similar. See also congruent (={brajvetaidu'i}). CLL 18.7.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a structure/arrangement/organization of $x_{2}$ [set/system/complexity].
valsi.notes: ($x_2$, if a set, is completely specified); See also {ganzu}, {morna}, {ciste}, {lujvo}, {greku}, {gerna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a member/element of set $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ belongs to group $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is amid/among/amongst group $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ may be a complete or incomplete list of members; $x_2$ is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership. See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a part/component/piece/portion/segment of $x_{2}$ [where $x_{2}$ is a whole/mass]; $x_{2}$ is partly $x_{1}$.
$x_1$ is approximately equal to $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (li) is a number/quantifier/digit/value/figure (noun); refers to the value and not the symbol.
$x_{1}$ is near/close to/approximates $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni).
digit/number: almost all (digit/number).
digit/number: most.
digit/number: many.
digit/number: several.
digit/number: few.
number: almost all of.
number: a little of.
digit/number: typical/average value.
digit/number: all except n; all but n; default 1.
digit/number: approximately (default the typical value in this context) (number).
digit/number: at most (all); no more than.
digit/number: less than.
digit/number: greater than.
binary mathematical operator: number base; [a interpreted in the base b].
attitudinal: desire - indifference - reluctance.
attitudinal: obligation - freedom.
attitudinal: intent - indecision - rejection/refusal.
digit/number:separates digits for base >16, not current standard, or variable (e.g. time, date).
number/quantity: 19 [nineteen].
convert number to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is (n)th member of set $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
convert number to portion selbri; $x_{1}$ is an (n)th portion of mass/totality $x_{2}$; (cf. gunma).
convert number to probability selbri; event $x_{1}$ has probability (n) of occurring under cond. $x_{2}$.
convert number to scalar selbri; $x_{1}$ is at (n)th position on scale $x_{2}$.
digit/number: number/digit/lerfu question.
null operand (used in unary mekso operations).
mathematical operator: null mathematical expression (mex) operator (used in >2-ary ops).
trinary mathematical operator: order of magnitude/value/base; [b * (c to the a power)].
join mathematical expression (mex) operands into an array.
elidable terminator: end conversion between non-mex and mex; usually elidable.
n-ary mathematical operator: operands are vectors to be treated as matrix rows.
n-ary mathematical operator: operands are vectors to be treated as matrix columns.
reverse Polish mathematical expression (mex) operator flag.
elidable terminator: end math express.(mex) sumti; end mex-to-sumti conversion; usually elidable.
logical connective: sumti afterthought exclusive or; Latin 'aut'.
binary mathematical operator: nth root of; inverse power [a to the 1/b power].
convert selbri to mex operator; used to create less-used operators using fu'ivla, lujvo, etc.
convert selbri to mex operand; used to create new non-numerical quantifiers; e.g. "herd" of oxen.
utterance ordinal suffix; converts a number to an ordinal, such as an item or paragraph number.
higher-order utterance ordinal suffix; converts a number to ordinal, usually a section/chapter.
mathematical expression (mex) operator precedence (discursive).
digit/number: % percentage symbol, hundredths.
digit/number: fraction slash; default "/n" => 1/n, "n/" => n/1, or "/" alone => golden ratio.
$x_{1}$ is a fraction, with numerator $x_{2}$, denominator $x_{3}$ ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$).
$x_{1}$ is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions $x_{2}$, with probability distribution $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = {cuncu'a}, {cunselcu'a}, {cunjdi}, {cunseljdi}; based on "unpredictable"). See also {cnici}, {lakne}, {funca}, {kalsa}, {snuti}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ possesses/owns/has $x_{2}$ under law/custom $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is owner/proprietor of $x_{2}$ under $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_3$ is generally more important to the concept than commonly accepted for the English equivalent, since the concept is broader when unconstrained, and the nature/interpretation of possession/ownership is very culturally dependent); See also {ckini}, {ralte}, {jitro}, {steci}, {srana}, {tutra}, {turni}, {zivle}.

valsi.definition: logical connective: sumti afterthought connective question.
logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought conn question.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought conn question.
discursive utterance ordinal: finally; last utterance ordinal.
begin indicator long scope.
end indicator long scope; terminates scope of all active indicators.
end quote of questionable or out-of-context text; not elidable.
left parenthesis; start of parenthetical note which must be grammatical Lojban text.
elidable terminator: right parenthesis/end unquote; seldom elidable except at end of text.
